sentences.english: The name of the Russian astronaut who performed this feat was Leonov.
sentences.chinese: 建立这一功绩的苏联宇航员名叫雷诺夫。

sentences.english: The great achievements of Xiangnan Intifada have been recorded in history.
sentences.chinese: 湘南起义伟大功绩已经载入史册。

sentences.english: The number of ancestors patriots, fearless express feat legacy remain merit.
sentences.chinese: 多少先辈志士，无畏抒壮举，青史留功绩。

sentences.english: The Qin and Han dynasties had different bordland governance achievements.
sentences.chinese: 秦汉王朝边地治理的功绩成效各异。

sentences.english: His most vaunted exploits were exposed as largely fictitious.
sentences.chinese: 他最自豪的功绩，戳穿后才知大抵都是虚构的。

sentences.english: The government recognized his outstanding service by giving him a medal.
sentences.chinese: 政府为他颁赠勋章，以表彰他的“卓着”功绩。

sentences.english: Good deeds should be rewarded and evil deeds punished.
sentences.chinese: 功绩应予褒奖，恶行该受惩罚。

sentences.english: First of all, the film exaggerates Custer's war record.
sentences.chinese: 首先，电影夸大了卡斯特的战争功绩。

sentences.english: The feat earned skorzeny a hatful of medals .
sentences.chinese: 由于这一功绩，斯科尔兹内获得了许多勋章。

sentences.english: The feat earned Skorzeny a hatful of medals.
sentences.chinese: 由于这一功绩，斯科尔兹内获得了许多勋章。

sentences.english: Their good deeds will live after them.
sentences.chinese: 他们的功绩将永留人世。

sentences.english: Leaders on both sides have staked personal prestige and their legacies on the outcome.
sentences.chinese: 两岸领导人的个人威望和历史功绩都要看会谈结果。

sentences.english: As a great intelligent and capable emperor, Han Wudi had made many more achievements than mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 汉武帝一生雄才大略，他的功绩远远大于他的过失。

sentences.english: They tried to humble your importance in that achievement.
sentences.chinese: 他们企图贬低你在那次功绩中的重要作用。

sentences.english: He never spoke about his own merits.
sentences.chinese: 他从不说起他自己的功绩。

sentences.english: Its epoch-making merit was that it propounded the problem.
sentences.chinese: 他的划时代的功绩在于提出了这个任务。

definition: achievement/meritorious deed/contributions (for the good of society)
to confer a title/to ennoble/to knight/title of nobility
order of feudal nobility, namely: Duke 公[gong1], Marquis 侯[hou2], Count 伯[bo2], Viscount 子[zi3], Baron 男[nan2]
an official position/a job in the bureaucracy
to found a state/to open a closed country
